questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to give a 25% discount on a specific Product Option purchased in the Big Box bundle.

In which two ways could the admin configure CPQ to automatically apply this discount? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
A would apply it to the bundle and all options
The answer is A and B, tested in my org.

choices.B: Set the Option Discount (%) field on the Product Option for the bundle.
choices.C: Set the Option Discount (%) field on the Product Feature for the bundle.
choices.D: Create a Price Rule that applies the 25% discount when the product is added as part of the bundle.
choices.A: Set Discounted by Package to TRUE on the Product Option for the bundle.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) defines a Warranty Period in a field on its Products and wants to ensure that this Warranty Period is correctly stored on the Asset record. A twin field has been created on the Asset record. UC contracts from the Order.

When leveraging the twin field functionality to pass this information to the Asset record, on which object should the admin create a twin field?

choices.C: Create a different Line Item section for each Product Family and leverage the Conditional Print field to show the correct products.
choices.A: Populate the Sort Order field on each Product record to properly sort the Quote Lines within each section.
choices.D: Create a different Line Item section for each Product Family, and leverage the Filter field to show the correct products.
choices.B: Construct a formula field on the Quote Line object that returns the bundle's Name and Number, and use this field in the Group field on the Line Item section.

questions.question_text:
A user has added multiple bundles to the Quote. Each bundle consists of Product Options of the Product Families:
• Hardware
• Licenses
• Maintenance

On the output document, different line columns need to be rendered that contain the Products of each Family.

Moreover, the Product Options of each Family need to be rendered separately for each bundle.

Which two steps should the admin take to meet the requirement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A and D The Conditional Print field can be used to control which products appear in each section based on the Product Family, making it possible to show different families separately. Using the Filter field to define which products appear in each section allows the admin to meet the requirement of separating Product Families without creating unnecessary complexity. Why Options B and C Are Not Correct:
Option B - Constructing a formula field on the Quote Line to use as a grouping mechanism could theoretically group items by bundle, but it is not as effective as using dedicated Line Item sections with Conditional Print or Filter Fields for organizing by Product Family.
Option C - Populating the Sort Order field on each Product record would help in sorting within a section but does not achieve the goal of separating Product Families into distinct sections with clear headers.

Selected Answer: BD
B -> https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_group_items_templates.htm&type=5

C option cannot be since Conditional Print will state if entire Family section appears or not. Instead D is the correct answer.
C. Set the Product’s Pricing Method = Block and Create Block Prices.

choices.C: Set the Product’s Pricing Method = Block and Create Block Prices.
choices.D: Set the Product’s Pricing Method = List and Create Block Prices.
choices.A: Create a Discount Schedule with Type = Slab and Discount Unit = Amount.
choices.B: Create a Discount Schedule with Type = Range and Discount Unit = Price.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to allow customers to return and receive credit for asset Products.

How should the admin meet the requirement?

discussion.content:
A. Set Asset Amendment Behavior to Allow Refund for the Product and reduce the Quantity on the Amendment Quote.

account > amend assets > reduce quantity to 0 > quote total will display a negative, indicating a credit

choices.C: Set Asset Amendment Behavior to Allow Refund for the Product and set a negative Quantity on the Amendment Quote.
choices.B: Edit the Effective Quantity field on the Asset record to reflect the updated Quantity.
choices.D: Edit the Quantity field on the Asset record to reflect the updated Quantity.
choices.A: Set Asset Amendment Behavior to Allow Refund for the Product and reduce the Quantity on the Amendment Quote.
